publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-3940 Mary Scanlon: Congratulations to Gordon and MacPhail, Winners of the Queen’s Award for Enterprise—That the Parliament congratulates whisky specialist Gordon and MacPhail, a family-owned business employing 130 people in Elgin and Forres, for winning the prestigious Queen’s Award for Enterprise: International Trade 2009 following a 94% increase in the value of its total exports over the last five years; considers that this award is recognised around the world and will be used by the company to increase its global reputation in the coming years, and congratulates Gordon and MacPhail for the work that it has done to enhance the reputation of Moray as the whisky capital of the United Kingdom, stocking around 300 different brands of whisky, including Benromach Organic, the world’s first bottled single malt to be fully certified by the Soil Association.

S3M-3940 Congratulations to Gordon and MacPhail, Winners of the Queen’s Award for Enterprise (lodged on 21 April 2009) Murdo Fraser*, John Lamont*, Jackson Carlaw*, Nanette Milne*, Jamie McGrigor*, Hugh Henry*, Bill Aitken*, Maureen Watt*

S3M-3940 Mary Scanlon: Congratulations to Gordon and MacPhail, Winners of the Queen’s Award for Enterprise—That the Parliament congratulates whisky specialist Gordon and MacPhail, a family-owned business employing 130 people in Elgin and Forres, for winning the prestigious Queen’s Award for Enterprise: International Trade 2009 following a 94% increase in the value of its total exports over the last five years; considers that this award is recognised around the world and will be used by the company to increase its global reputation in the coming years, and congratulates Gordon and MacPhail for the work that it has done to enhance the reputation of Moray as the whisky capital of the United Kingdom, stocking around 300 different brands of whisky, including Benromach Organic, the world’s first bottled single malt to be fully certified by the Soil Association. Supported by: Murdo Fraser, John Lamont, Jackson Carlaw, Nanette Milne, Jamie McGrigor, Hugh Henry, Bill Aitken, Maureen Watt
S3M-3940 Congratulations to Gordon and MacPhail, Winners of the Queen’s Award for Enterprise (lodged on 21 April 2009) Stuart McMillan*
